sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find (A x B) ∩ B and then find (B x A) ∩ B. Show that the results are not the same, hence proving that Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
